name: hannah
text:
man i am getting voting fatigue how do you figure one strip from the next when they are all basically golden.

also i find myself adopting roast beef's tone in my comments.

name: catachresis
text: It is pretty tempting to give 5s all the time, but then the truly special strips go unrewarded. Solid 4s, occasional 3 or 5

name: petitegitan
text: This is what I try to do too, but it is just so hard to not hit 5.  And the commentary definitely gets more and more "Achewood" as you read along during the day.

name: dracer2
text: Do you compare Achewood with other Achewood, or with everything else in the world, that is the eternal dilemma.

name: hannah
text: you've got to start getting inter- with it, because it's so consistently better than everything else it can only be judged against its own previous form. there is probably some kind of sporting analogy i could use here.

name: rowboat
text: I generally use Beef's face to decide, rather than the numerical value. Whatever face I made, I rate it accordingly. Beyond that, if it's a strip which I know I'll want to see regularly (there are many), I'll give it a five so that it appears on my profile page.

name: halfdirt
text: when the scale is from 3-5, it makes 1 and 2 meaningless.  Why not use the full scale?  3 does not mean 'bad'

name: soticoto
text:
3 is meant to be average for a reason.
Most get 3 from me.
Better ones get 4.
Ones with Philippe or Roast Beef suffering generally get a 5.
Ones where Onstad cops out from actually comic-making get a 1.

name: hawaiian_robot
text: And comments like this deserve chubbies. Well played.

name: sirfrederick
text: You haven't explained 2!

name: shutup_shutup
text: Here you go .

name: afterward
text: Did You Find This Comment Helpful? (yes.)

name: carlyle
text: What would we do without you, 2?

name: saint
text:
Voting for which is the best comic would be hard.
Thankfully, that is not what we are about.
Solid 5's. Don't stop.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: "Solid 5's, Don't Stop" will be my next blip-hop masterpiece.

name: slalvation
text: I decided I'd go with my urges to give fives the first time around, and then, when I've rated them all, I'll start over, re-evaluating, and leaving fives only the best ones.

name: pogo
text: Subtract two or three from your first votes until you can curb your enthusiasm a little.

name: huber
text: anything with Lyle, Nice Pete and Todd should get maximum points

name: deimosrising
text: Agreed. Sadly there be lots of haters who are not down, it would seem.

name: chrisb
text: Arthur is a delight!

name: professorhazard
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: gtc
text: You can haz chubbie.

name: mercuri0us
text: He is kind of a gay Bootsie Collins.

name: hateandwar
text: Oh my God that would be awesome

name: mangtastic
text: Doesn't that describe elton john?

name: donsoze
text: It's OK to call Nice Pete crazy. Just don't ever ever call him "of low mind."

name: juancarlos
text: Yeah, he was just mildly outraged by Pat's comment. He expected to inform the group about his crazyness at a more convenient time. Probably after destroying everyone with his van.

name: bookofsand
text: Here are some of their hands!

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Pete was miffed, but he's a veteran of Group. There will be plenty of Time later. For the Reckoning of Pat's Lifeline upon anonymous palms.

name: patkun
text: Does Nice Pete talk the same way as Roast Beef? They both have that little font and no punctuation...

name: fosters
text: I figure they both talk very quietly, but in a different way. There's the kind of quiet talker that is easy to half-ignore, and then there's the quiet talker you find yourself straining to hear because you get the vague impression that it is really fucking important that this guy doesn't think you're ignoring him.

name: professorhazard
text: They are both from Circumstances.

name: laserblade
text: I get the sense that Roast Beef talks very fast, as if he were afraid you'd stop listening any second, while Nice Pete just talks... very... slow... and... deliberately.

name: rad_chillies
text: 'Bad Problem' gives it a 4.  And Pete's expression in the 9th and 10th panels.

name: julia
text: Anger Counseling has become couples counseling.  Nice Pete feels so betrayed!  He is so nice, and this is how he is repaid!

name: somebreakfast
text: "Crying is nature's gas station" is now a phrase I commonly use.

name: mambonassau
text: And sad songs are like nature's onions.

name: gumfish
text: I'm pretty sure onions are nature's onions.

name: zem
text: it's not easy singing sad songs / when you can sing the song to make me glad

name: tasteful
text: lizzy mercier descloux songs are like nature's awesomes

name: shutup_shutup
text: That no one got this joke is like a mouthful of sores.

name: mangtastic
text:
Mr. Show.

I'm sure many people "got it" but did not say so.

name: tragicone
text: I can't even discern what that means. Gas stations evoke no special reaction o0r feeling in me.

name: boredom_man
text: Just that you "refuel" by crying.

name: nihraguk
text: this is why i don't go for anger management sessions. that, and the fact that i do not have anger management problems *cough*

name: boredom_man
text: FUCK YOU, ANGER PROBLEMS! SCREW YOU!

name: bixschmix
text: Do you think it's rad to have anger issues, nihraguk and boredom_man? Do you?

name: teira
text: Nice pete's capitalization always creeped the fuck out of me for some reason. Especially in his second book's description in the store.

name: stuart
text:
This is the best strip for pointing out how Onstad draws human hairstyles with the ears moved on cats but not the parts cut for them, because of all the side views, as well as Pat's gravity-defying glasses.

(Arthur's glasses stay up because of the shape of his head)

name: hendetta
text: Pat's glasses are part of his face. Also I imagine Tom Kenny doing Arthur's voice.

name: joeyramoney
text: i'm imagining more along the lines of bruce mcculloch from kids in the hall.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: mmn...i think he's more Scott Thompson.

name: hateandwar
text:
You know, weird as that sounds, I gotta agree. Kind of high pitched and nasal, but a real forceful, angry Scott Thompson, not like, Scott Thompson as Buddy Cole.

Buddy Cole is the voice I attach to Arthur.

name: shutup_shutup
text: I'm kind of picturing Kevin doing one of his more lady-like voices.

name: joeyramoney
text: it is significant that "bad" is capitalized, indicating that Bad Problem is a proper noun.

name: tekende
text:
And that there might be such a thing as a Good Problem.

Ah, wait--meeting someone shiny would be a good problem. A problem I enjoy.

name: boredom_man
text: Someone who is alive, with eggs and/or testicles?

name: pogo
text: Having three women interested in you could be a good problem.  Or having two nice job offers.

name: tekende
text: Good points. I have never had either of these things happen to me.

name: mangtastic
text: I have had three women interested in me at the same time.  It was a kind of complicated dilemma, and not necessarily good.

name: nessotron
text: Is this the only time Nice Pete has shown emotion?

name: captainpeepers
text:
No way man The Mister Band Arc has hella Nice Pete emotions.

They are all bad.

name: hendetta
text: He did not Accept that he cried.

name: achilleselbow
text: The capitalization of Accept is what persuaded me to hit 5. Perhaps it was because I had just watched the video for "Balls to the Wall".

name: pogo
text: IS Pete's dialog capped at the beginning of each line like a poem, perhaps?

name: professorhazard
text: He capitalizes words that have Importance

name: godfatherofsouls
text: HAS PETE BEEN WORKING OUT.

name: dwodles
text: Nice Pete looks frighteningly like a real dude in Panel 10.  ...ya know, minus the cat ears.

name: deovalente
text: Nice Pete is so mad, he can't think to go with his usual response to being insulted.  Emotionlessly disemboweling the offender.  He is so mad, he simply pouts.

name: bumfighter
text: Pat's an eco-geek because he's a crying Humvee.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Pat: There's a REASON barbers shouldn't make much money!
Lyle: right allbout pssd outta fn poems linin up new gig

name: satyr
text: Damn it. Just as I was starting to re-evaluate Pat based on his decent poetry (lame away), he goes of on this sort of crazy, I'm-the-kind-of-guy-who-should-have-his-face-sawn-off tangent again. I suppose I should have known better.

name: cagliostro
text:
I wouldn't dream of laming you for it, but... 'decent poetry'? Really?

What I'm trying to imply is that Pat's poetry completely sucks.

name: doubleclef
text: 5 just for Nice Pete's look of indignity

name: direhaggis
text: Pat and Nice Pete have a peculiar friendship. Nice Pete for seemingly being concerned about Pat's denial. Pat because he stone cold disrespected Nice Pete without a hint of hesitation. There is something going on here.

name: fineoakstructure
text: "There is a complicated power dynamic in that house."

name: doubleclef
text: Just Nice Pete's look of indignation at being called crazy is "5" worthy

name: atticusonline
text: Well...Pat is a dick.

name: aargh
text: Will we ever meet Mr. Gary?

name: tripleg
text: is the alt-text subtly foreshadowing pat's pictures from the magical realism camera? probably not, but it's fun to think about

name: all-star951
text:
Any strip that has Aaaaaarthur in it gets a 5 from me
Incidentally, for the longest time I thought HE was Mr, Gary.

I sincerely hope we meet Mr. Gary someday.

name: puguglypress
text: Accept

name: razorman57
text: how dared he? it wasn't a triple dog dare, so the implications are frightning

name: lolsworth
text: HOW DARE DARE DARE HE
